document.docAuthor: Khanjani, Mohammad, Mirmoayedi, Ali-Naghi, Fayaz, Bahman Asali & Sharifian, Tahereh
document.docTitle: Erythraeus (Erythraeus) populi Khanjani, Mirmoayedi, Fayaz & Sharifian, 2012, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new larval species of the genus Erythraeus (Erythraeus) (Acari: Erythraeidae) from Iran

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new larval species of the genus Erythraeus (Erythraeus) (Acari: Erythraeidae) from Iran

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype and one paratype larvae from pear lace bug, Stephanitis pyri F. (Heteroptera: Tingidae ), on poplar tree,
Populus nigra
L. ( Salicaceae ), College of Agriculture, Bu-Ali Sina University, Hamedan ( 34 ° 47 ´ 38 ´N, 48 ° 29 ´04´E, altitude 1838 m a.s.l), Hamedan Province, Iran ;
5 August
, 2010 ; by M. Khanjani.

Diagnosis. Basifemora I–III with three setae, Ti I with 15 seate, palp tarsus with eight setae (including one solenidion and one eupathidion), fD 60 , fV 16 , NVD 76 , IP
2493–2592
.

Description. The measurements are given in
Table 2
.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 2. Dimensions of
Erythraeus ( Erythraeus ) populi
n. sp.
(n =2)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Venter (
Fig. 5
). Intercoxal area with two pairs of setae,
1 a
and
3 a
. Seta
1 a
1.6 times longer than seta
3 a
. Opisthogaster with eight pairs of setae. fV= 16 .

Gnathosoma
(
Figs. 4
,
6, 7
). Infracapitulum with one pair each of subcapitular setae, Hy 33 ( 34 ) and adoral setae Or 20 ( 24 ). Palp five-segmented, femur and genu each with one barbed seta, tibia with three barbed setae and with bifurcate claw 26 ( 30 ), 31 ( 34 ) long, tarsus with eight setae including two smooth and four barbed setae, a eupathidium and a solenidion [ 13 ( 14 ) long] (0-0-B-B-BBB 2 -BBBBNNwx). Supracoxal seta 3 ( 4 ) long (
Fig. 3
).

Legs (
Figs. 8–16
). Legs long, especially all tibiae (
Table 2
); femora divided into basi- and telofemora. Tarsi terminate in two lateral claws and a claw-like empodium. Chaetotaxy of leg segments as follows: coxae 1 - 1 - 1 ; trochanters 1 - 1 - 1 ; basifemora 3 - 3 - 3 ; telofemora 5 - 5 - 5 ; genua 8 + 1 s + 1 k - 8 + 1 k - 8 ; tibiae 15 + 2 j + 1 k- 5 + 2 j - 15 + 1 j ; tarsi 27 +
2 x
+ 1 w + 1 e + 1 Cp - 23 +
2 x
+ 1 w + 1 Cp - 24 +
1 x .
Lengths of solenidia: w
I 22
( 24 ); w

( 17 ); e

( 4 ); Cp Ta

( 8 ); Cp Ta

( 20 ). Coxa I with one supracoxal seta 4 ( 4 ) long (
Fig. 5
).

Remarks. The new species belongs to the group of species with setal basifemora formula 3 - 3 - 3 . It can be distinguished from those species by the unique combination of characters and measurements shown in the diagnosis, and more extensively by their measurements and setal patterns which are shown in Tables 3, 4 (see more details those tables).

Etymology. The new species is named after the genus name of host plant,
Populus nigra
L. ( Salicaceae ), from which was obtained holotype and paratype of this species.
